{
  "file_path": "/home/smite/dev/protohackers/0-smoke-test/echo_server.py",
  "content": "#!/usr/bin/env python3\nimport socket\nimport threading\nimport sys\n\nclass EchoServer:\n    def __init__(self, host='localhost', port=8080):\n        self.host = host\n        self.port = port\n        self.server_socket = None\n        \n    def handle_client(self, client_socket, client_address):\n        try:\n            print(f\"Client connected: {client_address}\")\n            while True:\n                data = client_socket.recv(1024)\n                if not data:\n                    break\n                client_socket.send(data)\n        except Exception as e:\n            print(f\"Error handling client {client_address}: {e}\")\n        finally:\n            client_socket.close()\n            print(f\"Client disconnected: {client_address}\")\n    \n    def start(self):\n        try:\n            self.server_socket = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)\n            self.server_socket.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET, socket.SO_REUSEADDR, 1)\n            self.server_socket.bind((self.host, self.port))\n            self.server_socket.listen(5)\n            \n            print(f\"Echo server listening on {self.host}:{self.port}\")\n            print(\"Press Ctrl+C to stop the server\")\n            \n            while True:\n                client_socket, client_address = self.server_socket.accept()\n                client_thread = threading.Thread(\n                    target=self.handle_client, \n                    args=(client_socket, client_address)\n                )\n                client_thread.daemon = True\n                client_thread.start()\n                \n        except KeyboardInterrupt:\n            print(\"\\nShutting down server...\")\n        except Exception as e:\n            print(f\"Server error: {e}\")\n        finally:\n            if self.server_socket:\n                self.server_socket.close()\n\ndef main():\n    port = 8080\n    if len(sys.argv) > 1:\n        try:\n            port = int(sys.argv[1])\n        except ValueError:\n            print(\"Invalid port number. Using default port 8080.\")\n    \n    server = EchoServer(port=port)\n    server.start()\n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    main()"
}

{
  "file_path": "/home/smite/dev/protohackers/0-smoke-test/test_client.py",
  "content": "#!/usr/bin/env python3\nimport socket\nimport threading\nimport time\n\ndef test_client(client_id, host='localhost', port=8080):\n    try:\n        client_socket = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)\n        client_socket.connect((host, port))\n        \n        test_message = f\"Hello from client {client_id}!\"\n        client_socket.send(test_message.encode())\n        \n        response = client_socket.recv(1024).decode()\n        print(f\"Client {client_id}: Sent '{test_message}', Received '{response}'\")\n        \n        client_socket.close()\n        return test_message == response\n    except Exception as e:\n        print(f\"Client {client_id} error: {e}\")\n        return False\n\ndef main():\n    num_clients = 5\n    host = 'localhost'\n    port = 8080\n    \n    print(f\"Testing echo server with {num_clients} simultaneous clients...\")\n    \n    threads = []\n    for i in range(num_clients):\n        thread = threading.Thread(target=test_client, args=(i+1, host, port))\n        threads.append(thread)\n    \n    for thread in threads:\n        thread.start()\n    \n    for thread in threads:\n        thread.join()\n    \n    print(\"Test completed!\")\n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    main()"
}

Created a TCP echo server in echo_server.py that:


    

  • Listens on port 8080 (configurable via command line)
    • 

  • Uses threading to handle multiple simultaneous clients
    • 

  • Echoes back all received data unmodified
    • 

  • Handles at least 5 concurrent connections
    • 



Usage:


python3 echo_server.py [port]



Test with:


python3 test_client.py



The test confirms all 5 clients successfully connected and received their echoed messages back correctly.
